title: How to Clean a White Gold Ring

steps.headline: Stir a little dish soap into a bowl of warm water.
steps.description: Fill a small bowl of water about two-thirds of the way full with warm water. Mix in a few drops, or about 0.5 teaspoons (2.5 mL), of dish soap into the water. Continue mixing until you can see a few soap bubbles forming.Tip: To keep your ring in top condition, try to clean it once every 4-6 weeks. If your ring seems particularly dirty, feel free to clean it as needed.

steps.headline: Place the ring into the bowl for 5 minutes.
steps.description: Set the ring in the soapy mixture and move it around a bit to help it soak. Depending on how dirty your ring is, feel free to leave your ring in the mixture for a few more minutes. For easier handling, try using a mesh or metal strainer to place the ring into the cleaning mixture. If you’re worried that you’ll forget about the ring while it’s soaking, feel free to set a timer as a reminder.

steps.headline: Rub the ring gently with a soft-bristled toothbrush to remove any dirt.
steps.description: Remove the ring from the bowl and hold in one hand, using the other to scrub the ring delicately. Make sure that you use a gentle brush for this part of the process. If your ring isn’t that dirty, then don’t worry about scrubbing it that much.

steps.headline: Dry the ring thoroughly with a cloth.
steps.description: Use a soft rag or microfiber cloth to blot away any excess cleaning solution. Make sure to clean the outside and inside of the ring, and that there’s no soap or suds leftover on the metal. You can also use a chamois cloth for this, as well.

steps.headline: Clean your ring with a specialized steam cleaner.
steps.description: Use an at-home machine designed specifically for cleaning a variety of jewelry. To start the cleaning process, fill the designated tank with tap water. Next, follow the manufacturer’s instructions on how to place the ring into the machine. Wait for the cleaning cycle to finish before taking the ring out of the steam cleaner. These devices can be purchased online for as little as $50.

steps.headline: Test out an ultrasonic sound wave cleaner if you don’t want to use steam.
steps.description: Invest in an sound wave cleaner if you find yourself cleaning your white gold jewelry often. Additionally, this is a great option to consider if you don’t want your white gold ring to get wet. Follow the instructions that come with the device and place the ring in the machine for the recommended amount of time. Ultrasonic jewelry cleaners are available online, with prices starting at $40.

steps.headline: Go to a jeweler to have the ring cleaned professionally.
steps.description: Call or stop by your local jewelry store to have a professional clean your white gold ring. If your ring is an antique or you don’t want to clean it yourself, a jeweler is probably your safest bet. Additionally, you can ask a jeweler for recommendations on the best ways to clean your ring in the future.
